page.title: 01AGRICULTURAL WEST HUNTS
page.content: The block is primarily devoted to agriculture, with arable predominant - wheat and oilseed rape. Some store and fat cattle are maintained in byres and on small areas of grassland. There is some intensive pig and poultry rearing. Much of the arable land has been 'prairie-fied' with hedges and boundaries removed to give very large continuous fields. This factor, combined with the death of the elms, results in a wide, open landscape. Some tree re-planting is in hand. the block includes Old Weston and part of Brington. Old Weston is a small village with some outlying farms. Recent house building has brought in some newcomers, generally younger families working outside the village for apart from the small numbers engaged in agriculture, there is no local source of employment. R.A.F.
